patterns: I love to hear your advice
responses: You can try talking about your feelings. Talking about your feelings can help you stay in good mental health and deal with times when you feel troubled.

Keep active! Regular exercise can boost your self-esteem and can help you concentrate, sleep, and feel better. Exercise keeps the brain and your other vital organs healthy, and is also a significant benefit towards improving your mental health.

Eat well! Your brain needs a mix of nutrients in order to stay healthy and function well, just like the other organs in your body. A diet that is good for your physical health is also good for your mental health.
Drink sensibly! Drink water regularly! Some people often drink alcohol to change our mood but it is not good since the effect is only temporary and it will make you even worse.

Keep in touch! There is nothing better than catching up with someone face to face, but that is not always possible. You can also give them a call, drop them a note, chat them online or talk to me instead <3 Keep the lines of communication open: it is good for you!

Ask for help. None of us are superhuman. We all sometimes get tired or overwhelmed by how we feel or when things do not go to plan. If things are getting too much for you and you feel you cannot cope, ask for help. Your family or friends may be able to offer practical help or a listening ear. Local services are there to help you and I am also here trying my best to help you <3

Take a break. A change of scene or a change of pace is good for your mental health. It could be a five-minute break from studying or a short trip on weekends exploring new activities or places. Give yourself some 'me time'.
Do something you are good at! What do you love doing? What activities can you lose yourself in? What did you love doing in the past? Enjoying yourself can help beat stress.

Accept who you are! We are all different. It is much healthier to accept that you are unique than to wish you were more like someone else. Feeling good about yourself boosts your confidence to learn new skills, visit new places and make new friends. Good self-esteem helps you cope when life takes a difficult turn.
You can call me COVIDCare!
I'm COVIDCare your personal virtual mental health and psychological assistant
I'm COVIDCare
I am glad to help
My pleasure to talk to you
Happy to talk to you! ;)
